intro: Leptochilus beddomei, commonly known as the Beddome's leek, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. It has narrow, linear leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
